page.title: 10A VIEWING POINT-PENN BEACON.
page.content: Penn Beacon is the higheat point in the area.It is four hundred and twenty-seven metres above sea level and overlooks the whole area,which explains why it has a trig point on it.Part of the area,which includes Penn Beacon,is in the Dartmoor National Park.From the top of Penn Beacon,Plymouth and the surrounding coastline can be seen on a clear day. The land drops away to the south,west and south-west.From Penn Beacon most of the china clay workings can be seen, but part of them are obscured by the waste tips.The lowest point in the area is near the mica dams,about one hundred metres above sea level.
